item.title: Jason add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Jason add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lord, what fools these mortals be!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jason add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "One cannot be too careful with words, they change their minds just as people do." -- José Saramago

item.title: Jason add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "Reading is probably another way of being in a place." -- José Saramago

item.title: Jason add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Reading and sauntering and lounging and dosing, which I call thinking, is my supreme Happiness." -- David Hume

item.title: Jason add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "We talk so abstractly about poetry because all of us are usually bad poets." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jason add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jason add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Reason is, and ought only to be the slave of the passions, and can never pretend to any other office than to serve and obey them." -- David Hume

item.title: Jason add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "Those who restrain desire do so because theirs is weak enough to be restrained." -- William Blake

item.title: Jason add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "But the effect of her being on those around her was incalculably diffusive: for the growing good of the world is partly dependent on unhistoric acts; and that things are not so ill with you and me as they might have been, is half owing to the number who lived faithfully a hidden life, and rest in unvisited tombs." -- George Eliot

item.title: Jason add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jason add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "If absolute truth belongs to anyone in this world, it certainly does not belong to the man or party that claims to possess it." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Jason add a quote by José Saramago
item.description: "Men are all the same, they think that because they came out of the belly of a woman they know all there is to know about women." -- José Saramago

item.title: Jason add a quote by William Blake
item.description: "The man who never alters his opinion is like standing water, and breeds reptiles of the mind." -- William Blake

item.title: Jason add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jason add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Anyone who lives within their means suffers from a lack of imagination." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jason add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jason add a quote by George Carlin
item.description: "The reason I talk to myself is because I’m the only one whose answers I accept." -- George Carlin

item.title: Jason add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "If it turns out that there is a God...the worst that you can say about him is that basically he's an underachiever." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Jason add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Generally speaking, the errors in religion are dangerous; those in philosophy only ridiculous." -- David Hume
